conclusion: To determine the pressure of the gas when the temperature is 600 K, we need to analyze the given p-T graph and use the information from the V-T graph if necessary.
The p-T graph shows a linear relationship between pressure (p) and temperature (T).

premise: The general form of a linear equation is p = mT + c, where m is the slope and c is the y-intercept.
conclusion: Calculate the slope m: m = Δp/ΔT = (1.0 × 10^5 Pa - 0.5 × 10^5 Pa) / (400 K - 200 K) = 2500 Pa/K.

premise: Using the point-slope form with the point (200 K, 0.5 × 10^5 Pa).
Substitute T = 600 K into the equation p = 2500T - 0.5 × 10^5.
